did.unittitle: Richard Doddridge Blackmore to "My dear Master Stoughton," a young boy who has asked for his opinion on collecting autographs

scopecontent.p: He writes that the collecting of autographs is more interesting than that of "stamps & sundry other objects" but that it leads young people toward taking liberties as he receives several requests each week
